about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

name: python-htcondor
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.19.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: python-htcondor
    version: 8.9.7
source:
    patches:
        - paths.patch
        - python-archlib.patch
        - python-no-libpython.patch
        - rpath.patch
    sha256: bd3f208061a38e3602bcb15ba3bb2d24e60d00b5a0d962edcbf21e0119ba0c8e
    url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/archive/V8_9_7.tar.gz
build:
    ignore_run_exports:
        - gct
        - libgcc-ng
        - libuuid
        - pcre
        - python
    number: 2
    string: py38h8019cc0_2
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 0_gnu
        - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.34 h53a641e_4
        - binutils_linux-64 2.34 hc952b39_20
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_2
        - ca-certificates 2020.4.5.1 hecc5488_0
        - cmake 3.17.0 h28c56e5_0
        - expat 2.2.9 he1b5a44_2
        - gcc_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 hd420e75_6
        - gcc_linux-64 7.5.0 h09487f9_20
        - gxx_impl_linux-64 7.5.0 hdf63c60_6
        - gxx_linux-64 7.5.0 h09487f9_20
        - krb5 1.17.1 h2fd8d38_0
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.34 h53a641e_4
        - libcurl 7.69.1 hf7181ac_0
        - libedit 3.1.20191231 h46ee950_0
        - libgcc-ng 9.2.0 h24d8f2e_2
        - libgomp 9.2.0 h24d8f2e_2
        - libssh2 1.9.0 hab1572f_2
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.2.0 hdf63c60_2
        - libuv 1.38.0 h516909a_0
        - make 4.3 h516909a_0
        - ncurses 6.1 hf484d3e_1002
        - openssl 1.1.1g h516909a_0
        - pkg-config 0.29.2 h516909a_1006
        - rhash 1.3.6 h14c3975_1001
        - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 h3a0023d_5
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_0
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
        - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_llvm
        - boost 1.72.0 py38h9de70de_0
        - boost-cpp 1.72.0 h7b93d67_1
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_2
        - ca-certificates 2020.4.5.1 hecc5488_0
        - certifi 2020.4.5.1 py38h32f6830_0
        - gct 6.2.1550507116 he9ae1f9_1
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.7 he1b5a44_2
        - icu 67.1 he1b5a44_0
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.34 h53a641e_4
        - libblas 3.8.0 16_openblas
        - libcblas 3.8.0 16_openblas
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.7 h9cd45e6_2
        - libffi 3.2.1 he1b5a44_1007
        - libgcc-ng 9.2.0 h24d8f2e_2
        - libgfortran-ng 7.5.0 hdf63c60_6
        - liblapack 3.8.0 16_openblas
        - libopenblas 0.3.9 h5ec1e0e_0
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.2.0 hdf63c60_2
        - libuuid 2.32.1 h14c3975_1000
        - llvm-openmp 10.0.0 hc9558a2_0
        - lz4-c 1.9.2 he1b5a44_1
        - munge 0.5.13 h1a52d62_0
        - ncurses 6.1 hf484d3e_1002
        - numpy 1.18.4 py38h8854b6b_0
        - openssl 1.1.1g h516909a_0
        - pcre 8.44 he1b5a44_0
        - perl 5.26.2 h516909a_1006
        - python 3.8.2 he5300dc_7_cpython
        - python_abi 3.8 1_cp38
        - readline 8.0 hf8c457e_0
        - setuptools 47.1.1 py38h32f6830_0
        - sqlite 3.30.1 hcee41ef_0
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_0
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
        - zstd 1.4.4 h6597ccf_3
    run:
        - boost >=1.72.0,<1.72.1.0a0
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.7 he1b5a44_2
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.7 h9cd45e6_2
        - libgcc-ng >=7.5.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=7.5.0
        - python >=3.8,<3.9.0a0
        - python_abi 3.8.* *_cp38
test:
    commands:
        - python -m pip install --no-deps --index-url nothing htcondor
    imports:
        - classad
        - htcondor
    requires:
        - pip
about:
    description: 'The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,

        Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize

        the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have

        nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor
    doc_url: https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/
    home: http://htcondor.org/
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_family: APACHE
    license_file: LICENSE-2.0.txt
    summary: Python bindings for HTCondor
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - duncanmmacleod
        - jasoncpatton

about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.
